page.title: 05THE VILLAGE CHURCH
page.content: The present Rosemarket church was built around the year 1110 probably on the site of a much older Welsh church. Between twelve and twenty people attend church regularly, about the same number as have been going for the last 25 years. Communion services are held every Sunday morning.There is an evening service once a month. The vicar lives at Burton where he is the rector.A parochial church council is elected each year to help run the church.This year electric heating has been installed to replace the oil fired heating that broke down.The new heating includes tubular heaters under some of the seats.
